recipe_name: Seared beef tataki with steamed broccoli and ponzu-style sauce
author: Paul Rankin
method: For the beef tataki, season the beef fillet with salt and freshly ground black pepper and drizzle with olive oil. Heat a frying pan until smoking hot and sear the beef for 1-2 minutes on both sides. Remove from the heat and leave to rest for five minutes, before slicing thinly. For the steamed broccoli, place the broccoli in a steamer over a pan of boiling water and steam for four minutes, or until just tender. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. For the ponzu-style sauce, place the lemon juice, chilli flakes, soy sauce, salt and freshly ground black pepper into a small bowl and whisk to combine. To serve, place the sliced beef and broccoli onto a serving plate and pour over the ponzu sauce.
ingredients: 150g/5½oz beef fillet,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  olive oil, for drizzling,  small handful Tenderstem broccoli,  olive oil, for drizzling,  salt and freshly ground black pepper ,  ½ lemon, juice only,  pinch chilli flakes,  2 tbsp soy sauce,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
